IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE DEVELOP AND HELP SUSTAIN ORGANIZATIONS, PROGRAMS, AND SERVICES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO A VIBRANT CENTRAL VIRGINIA COMMUNITY THAT SHARE OUR VALUES OF DIVERSITY, INCLUSION, INDIVIDUAL DIGNITY, EQUALITY AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE DEVELOP AND HELP SUSTAIN ORGANIZATIONS, PROGRAMS, AND SERVICES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO A VIBRANT CENTRAL VIRGINIA COMMUNITY THAT SHARE OUR VALUES OF DIVERSITY, INCLUSION, INDIVIDUAL DIGNITY, EQUALITY AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.
IRS990.Desc: DIVERSITY RICHMOND OPERATES DIVERSITY THRIFT, A THRIFT STORE THAT RECEIVES FROM THE PUBLIC DONATIONS OF CLOTHING, HOUSEHOLD ITEMS, BOOKS AND FURNITURE. THESE ITEMS ARE THEN PLACED FOR SALE TO THE PUBLIC. A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF VOLUNTEER SERVICES ARE PROVIDED IN THE THRIFT SHOP IN SORTING, ORGANIZING AND PREPARING DONATED ITEMS FOR SALE. REVENUES PRODUCED BY DIVERSITY THRIFT ARE USED TO FUND THE OPERATIONS OF THE DIVERSITY RICHMOND, THE DESIGN AND PROVISION OF EDUCATIONAL, CIVIC AND CULTURAL PROGRAMMING AND THE PROVISION OF DIRECT CASH SUPPORT FOR AGENCIES AND GROUPS THAT PROVIDE SERVICES TO LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL AND TRANSGENDER LGBT) PEOPLE IN CENTRAL VIRGINIA.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: DIVERSITY RICHMOND OCCUPIES A 47,000 SQUARE FOOT FACILITY IN RICHMOND, VIRGINIA THAT PROVIDES FLEXIBLE MEETING AND PROGRAMMING SPACE FOR LGBT PEOPLE, FOR THE GROUPS THAT PROVIDE SERVICES TO THEM, AND FOR PEOPLE AND GROUPS IN CENTRAL VIRGINIA THAT SUPPORT THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION. DIVERSITY RICHMOND ALSO PROVIDES OFFSITE SUPPORT TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THE OPERATION OF INTERNET AND NETWORKING SERVICES THAT TIE TOGETHER THE EFFORTS OF GROUPS SERVING LGBT PEOPLE. DIVERSITY RICHMOND ALSO HOSTS A GROWING SCHEDULE OF PROGRAMMING EVENTS PRODUCED IN-HOUSE, INCLUDING MUSICAL PERFORMANCES, DISCUSSION GROUPS AND GALLERY SHOWS AND SPECIFIC PROGRAMS FOR OLDER LGBT PEOPLE. MANY OF THESE PROGRAMS ARE PROVIDED BY VOLUNTEERS. IN 2015 OVER 4,500 PEOPLE ATTENDED EVENTS PRODUCED BY DIVERSITY RICHMOND. THE ORGANIZATION IS ACTIVE IN SOCIAL MEDIA PREDOMINANTLY UTILIZING FACEBOOK AND YOUTUBE AND HAD 4,034 FACEBOOK SUBSCRIBERS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2015. IMMEDIATELY SUBSEQUENT TO THE TRAGIC SHOOTING IN ORLANDO, FLORIDA, SOCIAL MEDIA WAS UTILIZED TO MAKE SUBSCRIBERS AWARE OF THE TRAGEDY AND TO COORDINATE A VIGIL IN HONOR OF THE SLAIN AND INJURED PARTIES THAT WAS ATTENDED BY IN EXCESS OF 2.000 PEOPLE FROM THE RICHMOND, VIRGINIA COMMUNITY. THE VIGIL WAS ATTENDED BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS AT LARGE, RELIGIOUS LEADERS, POLITICAL LEADERS, BUSINESS LEADERS AND REPRESENTATIVES FROM LAW ENFORCEMENT. THE VIGIL WAS HELD ON TUESDAY, JUNE 14, 2016 AND WAS PROMOTED AND COORDINATED EXCLUSIVELY FROM VOLUMTEERS. IN 2015 THE ORGANIZATION PRESENTED ITS SCHALL-TOWNLEY AWARD (FOR RECOGNITION OF EXTRAORDINARY PERSONAL ACTION) TO ITS CHAIR FOR HER LIFETIME BODY OF WORK AND ADVOCACY LGBT ISSUES. THE AWARD IS NAMED AFTER CAROL SCHALL AND MARY TOWNLEY, THE COUPLE WHOSE SUPREME COURT VERDICT BROUGHT MARRIAGE EQUALITY TO THE NATION. THE AWARD RECOGNIZES ESTRAORDINARY PERSONAL ACTION AND IS PRESENTED ONLY WHEN TRULY WARRANTED. SPECIFIC PROGRAMS INITIATED IN 2015 BY DIVERSITY RICHMOND ARE DESCRIBED BELOW: THE IRIDIAN GALLERY AT DIVERSITY RICHMOND IS ONE OF THE FEW ART GALLERIES IN THE NATION SOLELY DEDICATED TO PROMOTING LGBT ARTISTS. THE GALLERY COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF LOCAL ARTISTS WHO HOSTED A NUMBER OF EXHIBITS DURING 2015 AND YEAR-TO-DATE 2016 AND HAVE SCHEDULED FIVE EXHIBITS DURING FOR 2017. DIVERSITY RICHMOND ALSO HAS RELATIONSHIPS WITH SEVERAL LOCAL SCHOOLS THAT AID STUDENTS WHO ARE ON PUBLIC ASSISTANCE, ENABLING THEM TO SHOP FREE FOR CLOTHING AT THE ORGANIZATION'S THRIFT STORE. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO SUPPLIES CLOTHING VOUCHERS FOR CLIENTS OF ROSMY (RICHMOND ORGANIZATION FOR SEXUAL MINORITY YOUTH), THE FAN FREE CLINIC AND SEVERAL OTHER LGBT NONPROFITS FOR THEIR CLIENTS IN NEED. EVERY WEEK, RICHMOND PUBLIC SCHOOL STUDENTS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES, VOLUNTEER AT DIVERSITY THRIFT. THIS PARTNERSHIP REINFORCES THAT EVERYONE CAN GIVE BACK AND THAT EVERYONE BELONGS TO COMMUNITY. DURING THE HOLIDAY SEASON 2016, DIVERSITY RICHMOND HOSTED A FAMILY-STYLE DINNER FOR MEMBERS OF THE LOCAL TRANSGENDER COMMUNITY. MANY LGBT PEOPLE ARE DISCONNECTED FROM THEIR FAMILIES AND THIS IS A SIGNIFICANT ISSUE WITHIN THE TRANSGENDER COMMUNITY. THE DINNER WAS WELL ATTENDED AND WILL BE HELD ANNUALLY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: DIVERSITY RICHMOND PROVIDED DIRECT CASH SUPPORT TO AGENCIES AND GROUPS SERVING LGBT PEOPLE IN CENTRAL VIRGINIA THROUGH BY AWARDING DONATIONS AND GRANTS. IN 2014, THE FOUNDATION PROVIDED CASH SUPPORT TOTALLING 61,476 TO THESE AGENCIES AND GROUPS. IN RECOGNITION OF THE SIGNIFICANT FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTIONS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER RICHMOND, VIRGINIA COMMUNITY THE ORGANIZATION WAS NAMED THE FOUNDATION PHILANTHROPIST OF THE YEAR BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF FUNDRAISING PROFESSIONALS - CENTRAL VIRGINIA CHAPTER IN NOVEMBER 2015.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ACCORDANCE WITH FASB ASC TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES, MANAGEMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE ORGANIZATION HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT TO OR DISCLOSURE IN ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OR TAX RETURNS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PAGE 3, PART III, LINE 17B

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR ROBERT PHILLIPS AS REFLECTED ABOVE HAS BEEN ALLOCATED TO BINGO OPERATIONS BASED ON TIME WORKED IN BINGO OPERATIONS VS. OTHER DUTIES OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THROUGH PERIODIC CORRESPONDENCE WITH GRANT RECIPIENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE M, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 32B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES THE SERVICES OF AN UNRELATED THIRD-PARTY, SHARED KNOWLEDGE, TO MARKET AND SELL DONATED BOOKS VIA THE INTERNET (PREDOMINANTLY THROUGH AMAZON). THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES 50% OF THE SALES PROCEEDS OF ALL BOOKS SOLD BY SHARED KNOWLEDGE.
THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES AS "DIVERSITY RICHMOND". THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES A THRIFT STORE BRANDED AS "DIVERSITY THRIFT". THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES BINGO GAMES BRANDED AS "DIVERSITY BINGO".
THE ORGANIZATION IS THE GRATEFUL RECIPIENT OF VOLUNTEER SERVICES IN ITS GAMING ACTIVITIES, THRIFT STORE OPERATIONS, BOARD ACTIVITIES AND VARIOUS PROGRAM SERVICES.

THE ORGANIZATION IS ACTIVE IN SOCIAL MEDIA PREDOMINANTLY UTILIZING FACEBOOK AND YOUTUBE AND HAD 4,034 FACEBOOK SUBSCRIBERS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2015. IMMEDIATELY SUBSEQUENT TO THE TRAGIC SHOOTING IN ORLANDO, FLORIDA, SOCIAL MEDIA WAS UTILIZED TO MAKE SUBSCRIBERS AWARE OF THE TRAGEDY AND TO COORDINATE A VIGIL IN HONOR OF THE SLAIN AND INJURED PARTIES THAT WAS ATTENDED BY IN EXCESS OF 2.000 PEOPLE FROM THE RICHMOND, VIRGINIA COMMUNITY. THE VIGIL WAS ATTENDED BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS AT LARGE, RELIGIOUS LEADERS, POLITICAL LEADERS, BUSINESS LEADERS AND REPRESENTATIVES FROM LAW ENFORCEMENT. THE VIGIL WAS HELD ON TUESDAY, JUNE 14, 2016 AND WAS PROMOTED AND COORDINATED EXCLUSIVELY FROM VOLUMTEERS. IN 2015 THE ORGANIZATION PRESENTED ITS SCHALL-TOWNLEY AWARD (FOR RECOGNITION OF EXTRAORDINARY PERSONAL ACTION) TO ITS CHAIR FOR HER LIFETIME BODY OF WORK AND ADVOCACY LGBT ISSUES. THE AWARD IS NAMED AFTER CAROL SCHALL AND MARY TOWNLEY, THE COUPLE WHOSE SUPREME COURT VERDICT BROUGHT MARRIAGE EQUALITY TO THE NATION. THE AWARD RECOGNIZES ESTRAORDINARY PERSONAL ACTION AND IS PRESENTED ONLY WHEN TRULY WARRANTED. SPECIFIC PROGRAMS INITIATED IN 2015 BY DIVERSITY RICHMOND ARE DESCRIBED BELOW: THE IRIDIAN GALLERY AT DIVERSITY RICHMOND IS ONE OF THE FEW ART GALLERIES IN THE NATION SOLELY DEDICATED TO PROMOTING LGBT ARTISTS. THE GALLERY COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF LOCAL ARTISTS WHO HOSTED A NUMBER OF EXHIBITS DURING 2015 AND YEAR-TO-DATE 2016 AND HAVE SCHEDULED FIVE EXHIBITS DURING FOR 2017. DIVERSITY RICHMOND ALSO HAS RELATIONSHIPS WITH SEVERAL LOCAL SCHOOLS THAT AID STUDENTS WHO ARE ON PUBLIC ASSISTANCE, ENABLING THEM TO SHOP FREE FOR CLOTHING AT THE ORGANIZATION'S THRIFT STORE. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO SUPPLIES CLOTHING VOUCHERS FOR CLIENTS OF ROSMY (RICHMOND ORGANIZATION FOR SEXUAL MINORITY YOUTH), THE FAN FREE CLINIC AND SEVERAL OTHER LGBT NONPROFITS FOR THEIR CLIENTS IN NEED. EVERY WEEK, RICHMOND PUBLIC SCHOOL STUDENTS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES, VOLUNTEER AT DIVERSITY THRIFT. THIS PARTNERSHIP REINFORCES THAT EVERYONE CAN GIVE BACK AND THAT EVERYONE BELONGS TO COMMUNITY. DURING THE HOLIDAY SEASON 2016, DIVERSITY RICHMOND HOSTED A FAMILY-STYLE DINNER FOR MEMBERS OF THE LOCAL TRANSGENDER COMMUNITY. MANY LGBT PEOPLE ARE DISCONNECTED FROM THEIR FAMILIES AND THIS IS A SIGNIFICANT ISSUE WITHIN THE TRANSGENDER COMMUNITY. THE DINNER WAS WELL ATTENDED AND WILL BE HELD ANNUALLY.
THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 WAS DISTRIBUTED TO THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BY ELECTRONIC MAIL AT LEAST TWO WEEKS PRIOR TO THE DATE OF FILING.
EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD SIGNS ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND MAKES AN ANNUAL DECLARATION OF ANY CONFLICTS. THE POLICY IS ENFORCED BY THE BOARD.

THE COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT IS ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD BASED ON A PERFOMANCE REVIEW AND A REVIEW OF COMPENSATION FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS IN THE REGION. AS PART OF THIS REVIEW, THE BOARD CONSULTS PUBLISHED SOURCES OF AUTHORITIVE INFORMATION AND CONSULTS WITH PERSONS HOLDING PROFESSIONAL EXPERTISE IN THE FIELD.
INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AND ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEB SITE.
